programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Dealers on a Mission"
programme.desc: Larry takes on an impossible mission: he’s been asked to find an item worn in space by Apollo 15 legend Al Worden. Torie searches for Russian space items for a museum in San Francisco and Cole goes on the hunt for an item from Apollo 13.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Money Trouble"
programme.desc: Larry gets the offer of a lifetime: a Soviet era space suit. Torie pays big for an Apollo 11 artefact but it’s not what it seems. Cole meets Apollo 7 legend Walt Cunningham.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "The Apollo Sale"
programme.desc: Torie’s son Jason joins her on the road. Larry turns ‘gastronaut’ when he comes across some space food; and a collector’s flash sale sees Cole bid for an Apollo 11 item with an incredible story.

programme.title: Space Dealers S1 - "Good Luck, Bad Luck"
programme.desc: Cole gets lucky when he finds a Russian space suit in an old box, but the gloves are missing. To find the gloves he has to strike a deal with Larry. Torie hears how Coke and Pepsi joined the space race and meets former NASA astronaut Winston Scott.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "The Launchers"
programme.desc: This episode examines a range of launchers that are integral to space research.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Mars"
programme.desc: This episode looks at the work of the probes orbiting Mars and the rovers exploring its surface.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "Saturn"
programme.desc: This episode reveals the work done by the Cassini probe that spent more than 13 years examining the Saturnian system.

programme.title: Zenith: Advances in Space Exploration S1 - "The International Space Station"
programme.desc: This episode exposes the working life of people who spend months orbiting in micro gravity.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Year of the Asteroid"
programme.desc: New breakthroughs in extra-planetary surveying and rocket propulsion are revealing the dichotomy of asteroids.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet S6 - "The Power of Water"
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll see ways that water is the backbone of energy and resources in different areas across the planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet S6 - "Teens Making An Impact"
programme.desc: In this episode, we’ll meet teens that are working to make the planet a better place with innovative ideas and lots of hard work.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Land Gaining Ground"
programme.desc: Earthrise looks at methods of land restoration and conservation as human causes and climate change wreak havoc.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Survival"
programme.desc: As the US no longer stands to be a global climate leader, China takes the mantle.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Antarctica On The Edge"
programme.desc: Earthrise sets off on a month-long journey around Antarctica to study the effects of climate change on the continent.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Coping With Extremes"
programme.desc: Earthrise assesses the depth of the crisis facing the world’s grasslands today, and explores some of the solutions that are being used to preserve them.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "Paris & Barcelona"
programme.desc: Bones introduce his trademark trickery to people in Paris and Barcelona, performing mind reading and an attempt to escape a straitjacket while breakdancing.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "London"
programme.desc: In this episode Bones is back in his home city, London where he stuns locals with his mind reading, card trickery and disappearing skills.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "South Korea - Night"
programme.desc: Bones is in Seoul, South Korea. He explores the city by night and performs a mixture of magic tricks, including a vanishing trick, coin tricks and card tricks.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "South Korea - Traditional"
programme.desc: In this episode Bones is in South Korea, where he visits Taekwondo group, the K Tigers, a tarot card reader and reveals the secret to the perfect card shuffle.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "The Environment"
programme.desc: In this episode we look at some of the ways technology is helping us solve the big environmental problems of our age.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "The Home of the Future"
programme.desc: In this episode we visit the home of the future, a place where automation, robotics and connectivity combine to create an easier and more sustainable life for its human inhabitants.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Mardi Gras, Rock Candy, Dentures"
programme.desc: A look at how the amazing, and massive, decorations on Mardi Gras carnival floats are created, how rock candy is twisted together, and a look at how dentures are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Helmets, Tea, District Heating"
programme.desc: How do they harvest and treat the world's most expensive tea? Plus, how does the Siekierki power plant of Warsaw, Poland heat half the city's homes?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Royal Enfield, Art Fraud, Milk"
programme.desc: How do they engineer the latest incarnation of the classic Royal Enfield Continental GT motorbike? Plus, how do 'art detectives' spot a forgery?

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Crash Testing, Delftware, Umbrellas"
programme.desc: How do they blend science and destruction at crash test centres? And how do they piece together the complex mechanism of a pocket sized umbrella?

programme.title: Breaking Limits S1 - "Speedskating"
programme.desc: Speed skater Beorn Nijenhuis and presenter Julien Kang visit laboratories to ask how does technology help to make the difference between silver and gold?

programme.title: Breaking Limits S1 - "Snowboarding"
programme.desc: How do innovators and athletes work together to beat the competition on the slope and the half pipe?

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Sailing to the Stars"
programme.desc: Solar sails, the latest in space travel technology, could one day help us reach nearby stars. Follow the exciting missions laying the ground towards a new form of space exploration.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Bear Cub Rescue"
programme.desc: Growing up in Montana, Casey Anderson come to love and appreciate wild animals at a very young age. He found a particular kinship with bears. One day he was faced with a fateful decision, leave and orphaned grizzly cub to die in the wild or save it.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Search for Japan's Lost Supersub"
programme.desc: The I-400 was one of the Imperial Japanese Navy's Sen Toku-class submarines, which were the largest submarines ever built before the age of nuclear-powered subs.

programme.title: Bright Now S1 - "Path to the Pros"
programme.desc: What does it take to become a professional tennis player? Both on and off the court preparations help build the streght of character and focused mind to take on the challenges of a sport that demands precision and superior athleticism.

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Test Your Science Genius"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. Do flying squirrels really fly? What caused the extinction of the dinosaur? How old are the fossils found at the bottom of the Grand Canyon?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "What’s Your Science IQ?"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. How smart is the modern-day robot? How come Earth has a protective atmosphere? Why does the U.S. have more tornadoes than anywhere else in the world?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Discover your Science Intelligence"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. Is it true that we only use 10% of our brain? Did Mars used to have an ocean? How much longer will we be able to live on fossil fuels?

programme.title: Sci Q S1 - "Measure Your Sci Q"
programme.desc: Fast-paced, pop-science show that will test your science I.Q. What causes a lightning strike? Where in our solar system is the asteroid belt? What’s the difference between a stalagmite and a stalactite?

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Denis Boivin"
programme.desc: Canadian engineer Denis Boivin has invented the track n Go, which makes it possible for any 4x4 vehicle to become a snowmobile in 15 minutes.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Oluwaseyi Sosanya"
programme.desc: Gravity Sketch is an intuitive multi-platform 3D creation tool developed by Oluwaseyi Sosanya and two other students of the Royal College of Art.

programme.title: Power & S2 - "Rob McCall"
programme.desc: Rob McCall has built a futuristic catamaran super yacht that looks like something that would transport a James Bond villain to a secret location.

programme.title: Power & S3 - "52 Blocks - Tear Coleman"
programme.desc: Tear hails from New York City and is a 52 blocks master, a defensive fighting style invented by African Americans in prisons. Instead of hitting, you block.

programme.title: Frontier Vets S1 - "Lion Club Rescue"
programme.desc: The vet students meet for the first time and travel 7 hours to the remote clinic. The resident vet, Dr. Greg, helps them muddle through the first real cases of their young careers.

programme.title: Frontier Vets S1 - "Tough Day at the Office"
programme.desc: The vets get situated in their dormitory accommodations. Dr. Greg deliberately pairs them according to their differences. Vets need to learn to work with colleagues and clients different from themselves.

programme.title: Frontier Vets S1 - "Elephant Down"
programme.desc: Roxanne let her puppy case, ‘Ripple’ stay overnight at the dorm. The group – especially her roommate Charlotte - is critical of this. Not only is she using the dog as a social crutch, it’s highly unprofessional to become so attached to a patient.

programme.title: Shark Dive TV S1 - "Bottom-Dwelling Sharks"
programme.desc: Shark Dive TV showcases Bottom-Dwelling Sharks and does a Deeper Dive analyzing how Sharks Breathe, Wobbegong Sharks and Caribbean Reef Sharks.

programme.title: Shark Dive TV S1 - "Zebra Sharks in the Indian Ocean"
programme.sub-title: Zebra Sharks in the Indian Ocean
programme.desc: Shark Dive TV searches for Zebra Sharks in the Indian Ocean, features amazing shark performances in the Philippines and does a Deeper Dive by examining shark finning and Thresher Sharks.

programme.title: Race of Life S1 - "The Race Underfoot"
programme.desc: Insects thrive in the relentless Race of Life, with diverse shapes and colors aiding their success.

programme.title: Wildlife Heroes S1 - "Stan Hutching"
programme.desc: For nearly 40 years, Stan Hutchings has been monitoring the migrations in The Great Bear Rainforest on Canada's northern West Coast, on behalf of the government.

programme.title: Wild Ones S1 - "SMARTEST"
programme.desc: Wild Ones draws inspiration from the rhythms of nature, delving into the wonders of the animal kingdom. This captivating series explores the diverse behaviors that define survival—hunting and feeding strategies, family bonds, defense tactics, and the intricacies of courtship and mating. Who reigns supreme in the wild? Discover the untold stories of nature's fiercest competitors and most fascinating creatures.

programme.title: Wild Ones S1 - "WILD AUSTRALIA"
programme.desc: Wild Ones draws inspiration from the rhythms of nature, delving into the wonders of the animal kingdom. This captivating series explores the diverse behaviors that define survival—hunting and feeding strategies, family bonds, defense tactics, and the intricacies of courtship and mating. Who reigns supreme in the wild? Discover the untold stories of nature's fiercest competitors and most fascinating creatures.

programme.title: Blue World S6 - "Family Adventures in Bonaire"
programme.desc: Blue World’s host, Jonathan Bird, takes his family, including his recently scuba-certified 11 year old son, on a dive trip to Bonaire in the Caribbean for some underwater family adventures. The kids find out that scuba diving is a family sport!
